10 танков из 10 штурмовиков.

185436929.review:
Free to play = Pay to win

Literally every aspect of this game is designed to get to you to spend real money on it. There are events that promise high rewards but it's total grind. There's always some booster pack on discount (a digital good?) and you really gotta invest lots of time playing to get good gear via the lootbox system.  My last straw was when a character hits level 30 the prices for one time bonuses go up by 2500%. Clearly making you want to buy in game currency. No thanks.

184827194.review:
Unfun, pay-to-win microtransaction hell. 

This isn't a port of the original Flash game - it's a total desecration of a fond childhood memory. Instead of recapturing the fun of SAS: Zombie Assault 4, they've crammed in countless predatory mechanics designed to nickel-and-dime you at every turn. Want a single gun? That'll be $30+ real money. Want to just shoot some zombies? You'll need to pay in-game currency for every shot you fire. I wish I was kidding.

If you've played SAS:ZA4 back in middle school like me, steer clear. It won't bring back nostalgia, only stomp all over it. 

If you've never played SAS:ZA4, also steer clear. This is a diseased husk of a game, a soulless mockery of the original. There's nothing for you here.

184799729.review:
this is a pretty decent game. I recommend if you like a top view game cuz it  remind me of old school game like alien shooter. It has variety of enemies and bosses and it's also pretty fun in multiplayer. I usually play it on mobile but playing it on pc honestly feel much better especially the control and clear sfx.

But the longer you play the game, it become more dull. I feel like they should add more mission and the cost of the item and boost are more not balance. you have to keep farming the 3rd mission ( since that's the mission who give the most cash ) and I become more bored by it. I feel like the cash drop are not balance after you level 30+. And some of the sfx loop aren't clean, that's kinda bother me moreover if you keep playing the same mission over and over again.

Overall, I would give this a 7/10

184455569.review:
SAS: Zombie Assault 4 - A Thrilling, Action-Packed Zombie Shooter Experience

SAS: Zombie Assault 4 is an intense, fast-paced, and immersive zombie survival game that promises to keep players on the edge of their seats with its nail-biting action and well-crafted gameplay. The game, developed by Ninja Kiwi, builds upon the foundations laid by its predecessors while introducing a variety of new features and mechanics that elevate it to new heights in the zombie shooter genre. Whether you're a fan of the franchise or a newcomer, SAS: Zombie Assault 4 delivers a thrilling experience that will keep you coming back for more.

Gameplay and Mechanics:

The core gameplay of SAS: Zombie Assault 4 revolves around players taking control of highly skilled SAS operatives, tasked with battling hordes of relentless zombies across various maps. The gameplay is straightforward, but this simplicity serves to enhance the fun and addictive nature of the game. The primary objective is to survive waves of increasingly difficult zombie enemies, which requires both quick reflexes and strategic thinking.

One of the standout features of the game is its smooth controls, which are easy to pick up but difficult to master. Whether you prefer tapping or using a controller (if available), SAS: Zombie Assault 4 accommodates different playstyles and input methods. The fluid movement mechanics and precise shooting mechanics make it a joy to control, while the ability to customize your loadouts adds depth and allows for personalization of playstyles.

In terms of combat, the game strikes the perfect balance between action and strategy. Players have access to a wide variety of weapons, ranging from powerful firearms to explosive devices. Each weapon feels distinct, and with the game's extensive upgrade system, you can continuously improve your arsenal to better handle the progressively tougher waves of zombies. Whether you prefer assault rifles, shotguns, or sniper rifles, SAS: Zombie Assault 4 gives you the freedom to tailor your approach to each encounter.

Co-op Mode:

Another highlight of the game is its robust co-op mode, where you and up to three other players can team up to face the zombie apocalypse together. The cooperative aspect of SAS: Zombie Assault 4 is where the game truly shines. Playing with friends or other online players creates an engaging and dynamic experience, as coordination and teamwork are crucial to surviving the increasingly difficult waves of enemies.

The game’s cooperative mode adds layers of strategy, as players need to work together to cover each other’s backs, manage resources, and utilize their unique abilities to their advantage. The thrill of fighting off zombies alongside friends, strategizing your loadouts, and battling massive zombie bosses is an experience that no single-player mode can quite replicate.

Graphics and Audio:

While SAS: Zombie Assault 4 doesn't necessarily push the graphical boundaries of mobile gaming, the visuals are still impressive for the genre. The game boasts highly detailed environments that are diverse and rich in atmosphere, from crumbling city streets to eerie, darkened warehouses. The design of the zombies themselves is grotesque and well-executed, providing a constant sense of unease as you face them in battle.

The game's audio is also noteworthy. The sound effects, from the roar of zombie hordes to the satisfying boom of explosions, are top-notch. The music adds to the intensity, keeping players engaged and heightening the tension as waves of enemies close in. The combination of eerie background sounds and intense combat noises makes SAS: Zombie Assault 4 an immersive auditory experience.

Progression and Customization:

Progression in SAS: Zombie Assault 4 is deeply satisfying. As you battle through waves of zombies, you earn experience points and in-game currency, which can be used to level up your character, unlock new weapons, and purchase valuable upgrades. The game offers a broad range of customization options, allowing you to tweak both your character and your loadout to suit your preferred playstyle.

The game also features various character classes, each with its own unique abilities and stats. This adds a layer of tactical depth, as choosing the right class for your playstyle or to complement your team’s strengths can be a game-changer in tougher levels. The upgrade and loot system encourages replayability, as players continue to grind for better gear and character improvements, keeping the game fresh and engaging long after the initial playthrough.

Challenges and Replayability:

The difficulty curve in SAS: Zombie Assault 4 is well-balanced. While the early levels are relatively straightforward, things quickly escalate, and the game starts throwing waves of tougher, faster zombies at you. The introduction of special zombie types—such as those that explode on contact, or those that can spawn additional enemies—keeps players on their toes and forces them to adapt their tactics.

The game also features multiple difficulty levels, which cater to a wide range of player skills. Hardcore players can enjoy the challenge of the highest difficulty settings, which introduce brutal waves and tougher bosses, while those who are newer to the genre can still have an enjoyable experience on easier settings. This scalability adds significant replay value, as players can continually challenge themselves with tougher enemies, higher levels, and better rewards.

Final Thoughts:

SAS: Zombie Assault 4 is a standout title in the zombie shooter genre, offering a combination of fast-paced action, engaging co-op gameplay, and a rewarding progression system. Whether you’re blasting through waves of zombies solo or teaming up with friends, the game offers an action-packed experience that will keep you coming back for more.

Its polished mechanics, strategic depth, and strong cooperative elements make it a must-play for fans of zombie games and action-packed shooters alike. SAS: Zombie Assault 4 is a perfect blend of thrilling combat, satisfying upgrades, and teamwork that provides hours of entertainment. With its highly addictive gameplay loop, it’s clear that this is one title that will keep players engaged for a long time to come.

184375358.review:
A ver, es un juego de vista senital, con graficos que casi parecen dibujados (creo que no lo son) y de ZOMBIES! Que a medida que subes de nivel aumentan en la cantidad que aparecen y su peligro para que no te sea fácil, que te permite jugar modos de juego especial para conseguir el mejor equipamiento, lo puedes jugar incluso en el celular conectando tu cuenta de steam al juego y de ahí jugar en solitario sin necesidad de internet. Tienes un nivel competitivo que cambia a diario para conseguir recompensas en base a la cantidad de tiempo que juegues y lo bien que lo hagas... Y ya no sé qué más decir jajaj

Jueguen al juego forros. Tiene ya más de 7 años y todavía me llevó 418 horas y estoy seguro que me va a llevar más... Además va asalir un nuevo juego de ninja kiwi y es parecido a este, se pueden dar una idea :D
